description: Updates an existing Managed Service for Apache Flink application. Using this operation, you can update application code, input configuration, and output configuration. Managed Service for Apache Flink updates the ApplicationVersionId each time you update your application.

parameters.name: ApplicationName
parameters.description: The name of the application to update.

parameters.name: ApplicationConfigurationUpdate
parameters.description: Describes application configuration updates. SqlApplicationConfigurationUpdate (dict) --- Describes updates to a SQL-based Kinesis Data Analytics application's configuration. InputUpdates (list) --- The array of  InputUpdate objects describing the new input streams used by the application. (dict) --- For a SQL-based Kinesis Data Analytics application, describes updates to a specific input configuration (identified by the InputId of an application). The input ID of the application input to be updated. NamePrefixUpdate (string) --- The name prefix for in-application streams that Kinesis Data Analytics creates for the specific streaming source. InputProcessingConfigurationUpdate (dict) --- Describes updates to an  InputProcessingConfiguration. Provides update information for an  InputLambdaProcessor. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the new Amazon Lambda function that is used to preprocess the records in the stream. KinesisStreamsInputUpdate (dict) --- If a Kinesis data stream is the streaming source to be updated, provides an updated stream Amazon Resource Name (ARN). The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the input Kinesis data stream to read. KinesisFirehoseInputUpdate (dict) --- If a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream is the streaming source to be updated, provides an updated stream ARN. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the input delivery stream to read. InputSchemaUpdate (dict) --- Describes the data format on the streaming source, and how record elements on the streaming source map to columns of the in-application stream that is created. RecordFormatUpdate (dict) --- Specifies the format of the records on the streaming source. The type of record format. MappingParameters (dict) --- When you configure application input at the time of creating or updating an application, provides additional mapping information specific to the record format (such as JSON, CSV, or record fields delimited by some delimiter) on the streaming source. JSONMappingParameters (dict) --- Provides additional mapping information when JSON is the record format on the streaming source. The path to the top-level parent that contains the records. CSVMappingParameters (dict) --- Provides additional mapping information when the record format uses delimiters (for example, CSV). The row delimiter. For example, in a CSV format, --n' is the typical row delimiter. The column delimiter. For example, in a CSV format, a comma (',') is the typical column delimiter. RecordEncodingUpdate (string) --- Specifies the encoding of the records in the streaming source; for example, UTF-8. RecordColumnUpdates (list) --- A list of RecordColumn objects. Each object describes the mapping of the streaming source element to the corresponding column in the in-application stream. (dict) --- For a SQL-based Kinesis Data Analytics application, describes the mapping of each data element in the streaming source to the corresponding column in the in-application stream. Also used to describe the format of the reference data source. The name of the column that is created in the in-application input stream or reference table. Mapping (string) --- A reference to the data element in the streaming input or the reference data source. The type of column created in the in-application input stream or reference table. InputParallelismUpdate (dict) --- Describes the parallelism updates (the number of in-application streams Kinesis Data Analytics creates for the specific streaming source). The number of in-application streams to create for the specified streaming source. OutputUpdates (list) --- The array of  OutputUpdate objects describing the new destination streams used by the application. (dict) --- For a SQL-based Kinesis Data Analytics application, describes updates to the output configuration identified by the OutputId. Identifies the specific output configuration that you want to update. NameUpdate (string) --- If you want to specify a different in-application stream for this output configuration, use this field to specify the new in-application stream name. KinesisStreamsOutputUpdate (dict) --- Describes a Kinesis data stream as the destination for the output. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Kinesis data stream where you want to write the output. KinesisFirehoseOutputUpdate (dict) --- Describes a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream as the destination for the output. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the delivery stream to write to. LambdaOutputUpdate (dict) --- Describes an Amazon Lambda function as the destination for the output. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the destination Amazon Lambda function. DestinationSchemaUpdate (dict) --- Describes the data format when records are written to the destination. Specifies the format of the records on the output stream. ReferenceDataSourceUpdates (list) --- The array of  ReferenceDataSourceUpdate objects describing the new reference data sources used by the application. (dict) --- When you update a reference data source configuration for a SQL-based Kinesis Data Analytics application, this object provides all the updated values (such as the source bucket name and object key name), the in-application table name that is created, and updated mapping information that maps the data in the Amazon S3 object to the in-application reference table that is created. The ID of the reference data source that is being updated. You can use the  DescribeApplication operation to get this value. TableNameUpdate (string) --- The in-application table name that is created by this update. S3ReferenceDataSourceUpdate (dict) --- Describes the S3 bucket name, object key name, and IAM role that Kinesis Data Analytics can assume to read the Amazon S3 object on your behalf and populate the in-application reference table. BucketARNUpdate (string) --- The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the S3 bucket. FileKeyUpdate (string) --- The object key name. ReferenceSchemaUpdate (dict) --- Describes the format of the data in the streaming source, and how each data element maps to corresponding columns created in the in-application stream. Specifies the format of the records on the streaming source. RecordEncoding (string) --- Specifies the encoding of the records in the streaming source. For example, UTF-8. A list of RecordColumn objects. ApplicationCodeConfigurationUpdate (dict) --- Describes updates to an application's code configuration. CodeContentTypeUpdate (string) --- Describes updates to the code content type. CodeContentUpdate (dict) --- Describes updates to the code content of an application. TextContentUpdate (string) --- Describes an update to the text code for an application. ZipFileContentUpdate (bytes) --- Describes an update to the zipped code for an application. S3ContentLocationUpdate (dict) --- Describes an update to the location of code for an application. BucketARNUpdate (string) --- The new Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the S3 bucket containing the application code. FileKeyUpdate (string) --- The new file key for the object containing the application code. ObjectVersionUpdate (string) --- The new version of the object containing the application code. FlinkApplicationConfigurationUpdate (dict) --- Describes updates to a Managed Service for Apache Flink application's configuration. CheckpointConfigurationUpdate (dict) --- Describes updates to an application's checkpointing configuration. Checkpointing is the process of persisting application state for fault tolerance. ConfigurationTypeUpdate (string) --- Describes updates to whether the application uses the default checkpointing behavior of Managed Service for Apache Flink. You must set this property to CUSTOM in order to set the CheckpointingEnabled, CheckpointInterval, or MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints parameters. CheckpointingEnabledUpdate (boolean) --- Describes updates to whether checkpointing is enabled for an application. CheckpointIntervalUpdate (integer) --- Describes updates to the interval in milliseconds between checkpoint operations. MinPauseBetweenCheckpointsUpdate (integer) --- Describes updates to the minimum time in milliseconds after a checkpoint operation completes that a new checkpoint operation can start. MonitoringConfigurationUpdate (dict) --- Describes updates to the configuration parameters for Amazon CloudWatch logging for an application. ConfigurationTypeUpdate (string) --- Describes updates to whether to use the default CloudWatch logging configuration for an application. You must set this property to CUSTOM in order to set the LogLevel or MetricsLevel parameters. MetricsLevelUpdate (string) --- Describes updates to the granularity of the CloudWatch Logs for an application. The Parallelism level is not recommended for applications with a Parallelism over 64 due to excessive costs. LogLevelUpdate (string) --- Describes updates to the verbosity of the CloudWatch Logs for an application. ParallelismConfigurationUpdate (dict) --- Describes updates to the parameters for how an application executes multiple tasks simultaneously. ConfigurationTypeUpdate (string) --- Describes updates to whether the application uses the default parallelism for the Managed Service for Apache Flink service, or if a custom parallelism is used. You must set this property to CUSTOM in order to change your application's AutoScalingEnabled, Parallelism, or ParallelismPerKPU properties. ParallelismUpdate (integer) --- Describes updates to the initial number of parallel tasks an application can perform. If AutoScalingEnabled is set to True, then Managed Service for Apache Flink can increase the CurrentParallelism value in response to application load. The service can increase CurrentParallelism up to the maximum parallelism, which is ParalellismPerKPU times the maximum KPUs for the application. The maximum KPUs for an application is 32 by default, and can be increased by requesting a limit increase. If application load is reduced, the service will reduce CurrentParallelism down to the Parallelism setting. ParallelismPerKPUUpdate (integer) --- Describes updates to the number of parallel tasks an application can perform per Kinesis Processing Unit (KPU) used by the application. AutoScalingEnabledUpdate (boolean) --- Describes updates to whether the Managed Service for Apache Flink service can increase the parallelism of a Managed Service for Apache Flink application in response to increased throughput. EnvironmentPropertyUpdates (dict) --- Describes updates to the environment properties for a Managed Service for Apache Flink application. Describes updates to the execution property groups. (dict) --- Property key-value pairs passed into an application. Describes the key of an application execution property key-value pair. Describes the value of an application execution property key-value pair. (string) --- (string) --- ApplicationSnapshotConfigurationUpdate (dict) --- Describes whether snapshots are enabled for a Managed Service for Apache Flink application. Describes updates to whether snapshots are enabled for an application. ApplicationSystemRollbackConfigurationUpdate (dict) --- Describes system rollback configuration for a Managed Service for Apache Flink application VpcConfigurationUpdates (list) --- Updates to the array of descriptions of VPC configurations available to the application. (dict) --- Describes updates to the VPC configuration used by the application. Describes an update to the ID of the VPC configuration. SubnetIdUpdates (list) --- Describes updates to the array of Subnet IDs used by the VPC configuration. (string) --- SecurityGroupIdUpdates (list) --- Describes updates to the array of SecurityGroup IDs used by the VPC configuration. (string) --- ZeppelinApplicationConfigurationUpdate (dict) --- Updates to the configuration of a Managed Service for Apache Flink Studio notebook. MonitoringConfigurationUpdate (dict) --- Updates to the monitoring configuration of a Managed Service for Apache Flink Studio notebook. Updates to the logging level for Apache Zeppelin within a Managed Service for Apache Flink Studio notebook. CatalogConfigurationUpdate (dict) --- Updates to the configuration of the Amazon Glue Data Catalog that is associated with the Managed Service for Apache Flink Studio notebook. Updates to the configuration parameters for the default Amazon Glue database. You use this database for SQL queries that you write in a Managed Service for Apache Flink Studio notebook. The updated Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the database. DeployAsApplicationConfigurationUpdate (dict) --- Updates to the configuration information required to deploy an Amazon Data Analytics Studio notebook as an application with durable state. S3ContentLocationUpdate (dict) --- Updates to the location that holds the data required to specify an Amazon Data Analytics application. BucketARNUpdate (string) --- The updated Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the S3 bucket. BasePathUpdate (string) --- The updated S3 bucket path. CustomArtifactsConfigurationUpdate (list) --- Updates to the customer artifacts. Custom artifacts are dependency JAR files and user-defined functions (UDF). (dict) --- Specifies dependency JARs, as well as JAR files that contain user-defined functions (UDF). UDF stands for user-defined functions. This type of artifact must be in an S3 bucket. A DEPENDENCY_JAR can be in either Maven or an S3 bucket. S3ContentLocation (dict) --- For a Managed Service for Apache Flink application provides a description of an Amazon S3 object, including the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the S3 bucket, the name of the Amazon S3 object that contains the data, and the version number of the Amazon S3 object that contains the data. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the S3 bucket containing the application code. The file key for the object containing the application code. ObjectVersion (string) --- The version of the object containing the application code. MavenReference (dict) --- The parameters required to fully specify a Maven reference. The group ID of the Maven reference. The artifact ID of the Maven reference. The version of the Maven reference.

nested_params.name: ApplicationCodeConfigurationUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes updates to an application's code configuration.

nested_params.name: CodeContentTypeUpdate

nested_params.name: CodeContentUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes updates to the code content of an application.

nested_params.name: TextContentUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes an update to the text code for an application.

nested_params.name: ZipFileContentUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes an update to the zipped code for an application.

nested_params.name: FlinkApplicationConfigurationUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes updates to a Managed Service for Apache Flink application's configuration.

nested_params.name: CheckpointConfigurationUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes updates to an application's checkpointing configuration. Checkpointing is the process of persisting application state for fault tolerance.

nested_params.name: ConfigurationTypeUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes updates to whether the application uses the default checkpointing behavior of Managed Service for Apache Flink. You must set this property to CUSTOM in order to set the CheckpointingEnabled, CheckpointInterval, or MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints parameters.

nested_params.name: CheckpointingEnabledUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes updates to whether checkpointing is enabled for an application.

nested_params.name: CheckpointIntervalUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes updates to the interval in milliseconds between checkpoint operations.

nested_params.name: MinPauseBetweenCheckpointsUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes updates to the minimum time in milliseconds after a checkpoint operation completes that a new checkpoint operation can start.

nested_params.name: MonitoringConfigurationUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes updates to the configuration parameters for Amazon CloudWatch logging for an application.

nested_params.name: ConfigurationTypeUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes updates to whether to use the default CloudWatch logging configuration for an application. You must set this property to CUSTOM in order to set the LogLevel or MetricsLevel parameters.

nested_params.name: MetricsLevelUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes updates to the granularity of the CloudWatch Logs for an application. The Parallelism level is not recommended for applications with a Parallelism over 64 due to excessive costs.

nested_params.name: LogLevelUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes updates to the verbosity of the CloudWatch Logs for an application.

nested_params.name: ParallelismConfigurationUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes updates to the parameters for how an application executes multiple tasks simultaneously.

nested_params.name: ConfigurationTypeUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes updates to whether the application uses the default parallelism for the Managed Service for Apache Flink service, or if a custom parallelism is used. You must set this property to CUSTOM in order to change your application's AutoScalingEnabled, Parallelism, or ParallelismPerKPU properties.

nested_params.name: ParallelismUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes updates to the initial number of parallel tasks an application can perform. If AutoScalingEnabled is set to True, then Managed Service for Apache Flink can increase the CurrentParallelism value in response to application load. The service can increase CurrentParallelism up to the maximum parallelism, which is ParalellismPerKPU times the maximum KPUs for the application. The maximum KPUs for an application is 32 by default, and can be increased by requesting a limit increase. If application load is reduced, the service will reduce CurrentParallelism down to the Parallelism setting.

nested_params.name: ParallelismPerKPUUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes updates to the number of parallel tasks an application can perform per Kinesis Processing Unit (KPU) used by the application.

nested_params.name: AutoScalingEnabledUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes updates to whether the Managed Service for Apache Flink service can increase the parallelism of a Managed Service for Apache Flink application in response to increased throughput.

nested_params.name: EnvironmentPropertyUpdates
nested_params.description: Describes updates to the environment properties for a Managed Service for Apache Flink application.

nested_params.name: PropertyGroups
nested_params.description: Describes updates to the execution property groups.

nested_params.name: PropertyGroupId
nested_params.description: Describes the key of an application execution property key-value pair.

nested_params.name: PropertyMap
nested_params.description: Describes the value of an application execution property key-value pair.

nested_params.name: ApplicationSnapshotConfigurationUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes whether snapshots are enabled for a Managed Service for Apache Flink application.

nested_params.name: SnapshotsEnabledUpdate
nested_params.description: Describes updates to whether snapshots are enabled for an application.

nested_params.name: VpcConfigurationUpdates
nested_params.description: Updates to the array of descriptions of VPC configurations available to the application.

nested_params.name: VpcConfigurationId
nested_params.description: Describes an update to the ID of the VPC configuration.

nested_params.name: SubnetIdUpdates
nested_params.description: Describes updates to the array of Subnet IDs used by the VPC configuration.

nested_params.name: SecurityGroupIdUpdates
nested_params.description: Describes updates to the array of SecurityGroup IDs used by the VPC configuration.

nested_params.name: ZeppelinApplicationConfigurationUpdate
nested_params.description: Updates to the configuration of a Managed Service for Apache Flink Studio notebook.

nested_params.name: MonitoringConfigurationUpdate
nested_params.description: Updates to the monitoring configuration of a Managed Service for Apache Flink Studio notebook.

nested_params.name: LogLevelUpdate
nested_params.description: Updates to the logging level for Apache Zeppelin within a Managed Service for Apache Flink Studio notebook.

nested_params.name: CatalogConfigurationUpdate
nested_params.description: Updates to the configuration of the Amazon Glue Data Catalog that is associated with the Managed Service for Apache Flink Studio notebook.

nested_params.name: GlueDataCatalogConfigurationUpdate
nested_params.description: Updates to the configuration parameters for the default Amazon Glue database. You use this database for SQL queries that you write in a Managed Service for Apache Flink Studio notebook.

nested_params.name: DatabaseARNUpdate
nested_params.description: The updated Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the database.

nested_params.name: DeployAsApplicationConfigurationUpdate
nested_params.description: Updates to the configuration information required to deploy an Amazon Data Analytics Studio notebook as an application with durable state.

nested_params.name: S3ContentLocationUpdate
nested_params.description: Updates to the location that holds the data required to specify an Amazon Data Analytics application.

nested_params.name: BucketARNUpdate
nested_params.description: The updated Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the S3 bucket.

nested_params.name: BasePathUpdate
nested_params.description: The updated S3 bucket path.

nested_params.name: CustomArtifactsConfigurationUpdate
nested_params.description: Updates to the customer artifacts. Custom artifacts are dependency JAR files and user-defined functions (UDF).

nested_params.name: ArtifactType
nested_params.description: UDF stands for user-defined functions. This type of artifact must be in an S3 bucket. A DEPENDENCY_JAR can be in either Maven or an S3 bucket.

nested_params.name: S3ContentLocation
nested_params.description: For a Managed Service for Apache Flink application provides a description of an Amazon S3 object, including the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the S3 bucket, the name of the Amazon S3 object that contains the data, and the version number of the Amazon S3 object that contains the data.

nested_params.name: BucketARN
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the S3 bucket containing the application code.

nested_params.name: FileKey
nested_params.description: The file key for the object containing the application code.

nested_params.name: ObjectVersion
nested_params.description: The version of the object containing the application code.

nested_params.name: MavenReference
nested_params.description: The parameters required to fully specify a Maven reference.

nested_params.name: GroupId
nested_params.description: The group ID of the Maven reference.

nested_params.name: ArtifactId
nested_params.description: The artifact ID of the Maven reference.

nested_params.name: Version
nested_params.description: The version of the Maven reference.

parameters.name: RunConfigurationUpdate
parameters.description: Describes updates to the application's starting parameters. FlinkRunConfiguration (dict) --- Describes the starting parameters for a Managed Service for Apache Flink application. AllowNonRestoredState (boolean) --- When restoring from a snapshot, specifies whether the runtime is allowed to skip a state that cannot be mapped to the new program. This will happen if the program is updated between snapshots to remove stateful parameters, and state data in the snapshot no longer corresponds to valid application data. For more information, see Allowing Non-Restored State in the Apache Flink documentation. ApplicationRestoreConfiguration (dict) --- Describes updates to the restore behavior of a restarting application. Specifies how the application should be restored. SnapshotName (string) --- The identifier of an existing snapshot of application state to use to restart an application. The application uses this value if RESTORE_FROM_CUSTOM_SNAPSHOT is specified for the ApplicationRestoreType.

nested_params.name: FlinkRunConfiguration
nested_params.description: Describes the starting parameters for a Managed Service for Apache Flink application.

nested_params.name: AllowNonRestoredState
nested_params.description: When restoring from a snapshot, specifies whether the runtime is allowed to skip a state that cannot be mapped to the new program. This will happen if the program is updated between snapshots to remove stateful parameters, and state data in the snapshot no longer corresponds to valid application data. For more information, see Allowing Non-Restored State in the Apache Flink documentation.

nested_params.name: ApplicationRestoreConfiguration
nested_params.description: Describes updates to the restore behavior of a restarting application.

nested_params.name: ApplicationRestoreType
nested_params.description: Specifies how the application should be restored.

nested_params.name: SnapshotName
nested_params.description: The identifier of an existing snapshot of application state to use to restart an application. The application uses this value if RESTORE_FROM_CUSTOM_SNAPSHOT is specified for the ApplicationRestoreType.

parameters.name: CloudWatchLoggingOptionUpdates
parameters.description: Describes application Amazon CloudWatch logging option updates. You can only update existing CloudWatch logging options with this action. To add a new CloudWatch logging option, use  AddApplicationCloudWatchLoggingOption. (dict) --- Describes the Amazon CloudWatch logging option updates. The ID of the CloudWatch logging option to update LogStreamARNUpdate (string) --- The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CloudWatch log to receive application messages.

nested_params.name: CloudWatchLoggingOptionId
nested_params.description: The ID of the CloudWatch logging option to update.

nested_params.name: LogStreamARNUpdate
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CloudWatch log to receive application messages.

parameters.name: RuntimeEnvironmentUpdate
parameters.description: Updates the Managed Service for Apache Flink runtime environment used to run your code. To avoid issues you must: Ensure your new jar and dependencies are compatible with the new runtime selected. Ensure your new code's state is compatible with the snapshot from which your application will start.

nested_items.name: ApplicationDetail
nested_items.description: Describes application updates.

nested_items.name: ApplicationARN
nested_items.description: The ARN of the application.

nested_items.name: ApplicationDescription
nested_items.description: The description of the application.

nested_items.name: ApplicationName
nested_items.description: The name of the application.

nested_items.name: RuntimeEnvironment
nested_items.description: The runtime environment for the application.

nested_items.name: ServiceExecutionRole
nested_items.description: Specifies the IAM role that the application uses to access external resources.

nested_items.name: ApplicationStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the application.

nested_items.name: ApplicationVersionId
nested_items.description: Provides the current application version. Managed Service for Apache Flink updates the ApplicationVersionId each time you update the application.

nested_items.name: CreateTimestamp
nested_items.description: The current timestamp when the application was created.

nested_items.name: LastUpdateTimestamp
nested_items.description: The current timestamp when the application was last updated.

nested_items.name: ApplicationConfigurationDescription
nested_items.description: Describes details about the application code and starting parameters for a Managed Service for Apache Flink application.

nested_items.name: SqlApplicationConfigurationDescription
nested_items.description: The details about inputs, outputs, and reference data sources for a SQL-based Kinesis Data Analytics application.

nested_items.name: InputDescriptions
nested_items.description: The array of  InputDescription objects describing the input streams used by the application.

nested_items.name: InputId
nested_items.description: The input ID that is associated with the application input. This is the ID that Kinesis Data Analytics assigns to each input configuration that you add to your application.

nested_items.name: NamePrefix
nested_items.description: The in-application name prefix.

nested_items.name: InAppStreamNames
nested_items.description: Returns the in-application stream names that are mapped to the stream source.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InputProcessingConfigurationDescription
nested_items.description: The description of the preprocessor that executes on records in this input before the application's code is run.

nested_items.name: InputLambdaProcessorDescription
nested_items.description: Provides configuration information about the associated  InputLambdaProcessorDescription.

nested_items.name: ResourceARN
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Amazon Lambda function that is used to preprocess the records in the stream.

nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that is used to access the Amazon Lambda function.

nested_items.name: KinesisStreamsInputDescription
nested_items.description: If a Kinesis data stream is configured as a streaming source, provides the Kinesis data stream's Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

nested_items.name: ResourceARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Kinesis data stream.

nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that Kinesis Data Analytics can assume to access the stream.

nested_items.name: KinesisFirehoseInputDescription
nested_items.description: If a Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream is configured as a streaming source, provides the delivery stream's ARN.

nested_items.name: ResourceARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the delivery stream.

nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that Kinesis Data Analytics assumes to access the stream.

nested_items.name: InputSchema
nested_items.description: Describes the format of the data in the streaming source, and how each data element maps to corresponding columns in the in-application stream that is being created.

nested_items.name: RecordFormat
nested_items.description: Specifies the format of the records on the streaming source.

nested_items.name: RecordFormatType
nested_items.description: The type of record format.

nested_items.name: MappingParameters
nested_items.description: When you configure application input at the time of creating or updating an application, provides additional mapping information specific to the record format (such as JSON, CSV, or record fields delimited by some delimiter) on the streaming source.

nested_items.name: JSONMappingParameters
nested_items.description: Provides additional mapping information when JSON is the record format on the streaming source.

nested_items.name: RecordRowPath
nested_items.description: The path to the top-level parent that contains the records.

nested_items.name: CSVMappingParameters
nested_items.description: Provides additional mapping information when the record format uses delimiters (for example, CSV).

nested_items.name: RecordRowDelimiter
nested_items.description: The row delimiter. For example, in a CSV format, --n' is the typical row delimiter.

nested_items.name: RecordColumnDelimiter
nested_items.description: The column delimiter. For example, in a CSV format, a comma (',') is the typical column delimiter.

nested_items.name: RecordEncoding
nested_items.description: Specifies the encoding of the records in the streaming source. For example, UTF-8.

nested_items.name: RecordColumns
nested_items.description: A list of RecordColumn objects.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the column that is created in the in-application input stream or reference table.

nested_items.name: Mapping
nested_items.description: A reference to the data element in the streaming input or the reference data source.

nested_items.name: SqlType
nested_items.description: The type of column created in the in-application input stream or reference table.

nested_items.name: InputParallelism
nested_items.description: Describes the configured parallelism (number of in-application streams mapped to the streaming source).

nested_items.name: Count
nested_items.description: The number of in-application streams to create.

nested_items.name: InputStartingPositionConfiguration
nested_items.description: The point at which the application is configured to read from the input stream.

nested_items.name: InputStartingPosition
nested_items.description: The starting position on the stream.
NOW - Start reading just after the most recent record in the stream, and start at the request timestamp that the customer issued.

TRIM_HORIZON - Start reading at the last untrimmed record in the stream, which is the oldest record available in the stream. This option is not available for an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream.
LAST_STOPPED_POINT - Resume reading from where the application last stopped reading.

nested_items.name: OutputDescriptions
nested_items.description: The array of  OutputDescription objects describing the destination streams used by the application.

nested_items.name: OutputId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the output configuration.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the in-application stream that is configured as output.

nested_items.name: KinesisStreamsOutputDescription
nested_items.description: Describes the Kinesis data stream that is configured as the destination where output is written.

nested_items.name: ResourceARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Kinesis data stream.

nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that Kinesis Data Analytics can assume to access the stream.

nested_items.name: KinesisFirehoseOutputDescription
nested_items.description: Describes the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream that is configured as the destination where output is written.

nested_items.name: ResourceARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the delivery stream.

nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that Kinesis Data Analytics can assume to access the stream.

nested_items.name: LambdaOutputDescription
nested_items.description: Describes the Lambda function that is configured as the destination where output is written.

nested_items.name: ResourceARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the destination Lambda function.

nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that Kinesis Data Analytics can assume to write to the destination function.

nested_items.name: DestinationSchema
nested_items.description: The data format used for writing data to the destination.

nested_items.name: RecordFormatType
nested_items.description: Specifies the format of the records on the output stream.

nested_items.name: ReferenceDataSourceDescriptions
nested_items.description: The array of  ReferenceDataSourceDescription objects describing the reference data sources used by the application.

nested_items.name: ReferenceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the reference data source. This is the ID that Kinesis Data Analytics assigns when you add the reference data source to your application using the  CreateApplication or  UpdateApplication operation.

nested_items.name: TableName
nested_items.description: The in-application table name created by the specific reference data source configuration.

nested_items.name: S3ReferenceDataSourceDescription
nested_items.description: Provides the Amazon S3 bucket name, the object key name that contains the reference data.

nested_items.name: BucketARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: FileKey
nested_items.description: Amazon S3 object key name.

nested_items.name: ReferenceRoleARN
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that Kinesis Data Analytics can assume to read the Amazon S3 object on your behalf to populate the in-application reference table.

nested_items.name: ReferenceSchema
nested_items.description: Describes the format of the data in the streaming source, and how each data element maps to corresponding columns created in the in-application stream.

nested_items.name: RecordFormat
nested_items.description: Specifies the format of the records on the streaming source.

nested_items.name: RecordFormatType
nested_items.description: The type of record format.

nested_items.name: MappingParameters
nested_items.description: When you configure application input at the time of creating or updating an application, provides additional mapping information specific to the record format (such as JSON, CSV, or record fields delimited by some delimiter) on the streaming source.

nested_items.name: JSONMappingParameters
nested_items.description: Provides additional mapping information when JSON is the record format on the streaming source.

nested_items.name: RecordRowPath
nested_items.description: The path to the top-level parent that contains the records.

nested_items.name: CSVMappingParameters
nested_items.description: Provides additional mapping information when the record format uses delimiters (for example, CSV).

nested_items.name: RecordRowDelimiter
nested_items.description: The row delimiter. For example, in a CSV format, --n' is the typical row delimiter.

nested_items.name: RecordColumnDelimiter
nested_items.description: The column delimiter. For example, in a CSV format, a comma (',') is the typical column delimiter.

nested_items.name: RecordEncoding
nested_items.description: Specifies the encoding of the records in the streaming source. For example, UTF-8.

nested_items.name: RecordColumns
nested_items.description: A list of RecordColumn objects.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the column that is created in the in-application input stream or reference table.

nested_items.name: Mapping
nested_items.description: A reference to the data element in the streaming input or the reference data source.

nested_items.name: SqlType
nested_items.description: The type of column created in the in-application input stream or reference table.

nested_items.name: ApplicationCodeConfigurationDescription
nested_items.description: The details about the application code for a Managed Service for Apache Flink application.

nested_items.name: CodeContentType
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the code content is in text or zip format.

nested_items.name: CodeContentDescription
nested_items.description: Describes details about the location and format of the application code.

nested_items.name: TextContent
nested_items.description: The text-format code.

nested_items.name: CodeMD5
nested_items.description: The checksum that can be used to validate zip-format code.

nested_items.name: CodeSize
nested_items.description: The size in bytes of the application code. Can be used to validate zip-format code.

nested_items.name: S3ApplicationCodeLocationDescription
nested_items.description: The S3 bucket Amazon Resource Name (ARN), file key, and object version of the application code stored in Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: BucketARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the S3 bucket containing the application code.

nested_items.name: FileKey
nested_items.description: The file key for the object containing the application code.

nested_items.name: ObjectVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the object containing the application code.

nested_items.name: RunConfigurationDescription
nested_items.description: The details about the starting properties for a Managed Service for Apache Flink application.

nested_items.name: ApplicationRestoreConfigurationDescription
nested_items.description: Describes the restore behavior of a restarting application.

nested_items.name: ApplicationRestoreType
nested_items.description: Specifies how the application should be restored.

nested_items.name: SnapshotName
nested_items.description: The identifier of an existing snapshot of application state to use to restart an application. The application uses this value if RESTORE_FROM_CUSTOM_SNAPSHOT is specified for the ApplicationRestoreType.

nested_items.name: FlinkRunConfigurationDescription
nested_items.description: Describes the starting parameters for a Managed Service for Apache Flink application.

nested_items.name: AllowNonRestoredState
nested_items.description: When restoring from a snapshot, specifies whether the runtime is allowed to skip a state that cannot be mapped to the new program. This will happen if the program is updated between snapshots to remove stateful parameters, and state data in the snapshot no longer corresponds to valid application data. For more information, see Allowing Non-Restored State in the Apache Flink documentation.

nested_items.name: FlinkApplicationConfigurationDescription
nested_items.description: The details about a Managed Service for Apache Flink application.

nested_items.name: CheckpointConfigurationDescription
nested_items.description: Describes an application's checkpointing configuration. Checkpointing is the process of persisting application state for fault tolerance.

nested_items.name: ConfigurationType
nested_items.description: Describes whether the application uses the default checkpointing behavior in Managed Service for Apache Flink.

nested_items.name: CheckpointingEnabled
nested_items.description: Describes whether checkpointing is enabled for a Managed Service for Apache Flink application.

nested_items.name: CheckpointInterval
nested_items.description: Describes the interval in milliseconds between checkpoint operations.

nested_items.name: MinPauseBetweenCheckpoints
nested_items.description: Describes the minimum time in milliseconds after a checkpoint operation completes that a new checkpoint operation can start.

nested_items.name: MonitoringConfigurationDescription
nested_items.description: Describes configuration parameters for Amazon CloudWatch logging for an application.

nested_items.name: ConfigurationType
nested_items.description: Describes whether to use the default CloudWatch logging configuration for an application.

nested_items.name: MetricsLevel
nested_items.description: Describes the granularity of the CloudWatch Logs for an application.

nested_items.name: LogLevel
nested_items.description: Describes the verbosity of the CloudWatch Logs for an application.

nested_items.name: ParallelismConfigurationDescription
nested_items.description: Describes parameters for how an application executes multiple tasks simultaneously.

nested_items.name: ConfigurationType
nested_items.description: Describes whether the application uses the default parallelism for the Managed Service for Apache Flink service.

nested_items.name: Parallelism
nested_items.description: Describes the initial number of parallel tasks that a Managed Service for Apache Flink application can perform. If AutoScalingEnabled is set to True, then Managed Service for Apache Flink can increase the CurrentParallelism value in response to application load. The service can increase CurrentParallelism up to the maximum parallelism, which is ParalellismPerKPU times the maximum KPUs for the application. The maximum KPUs for an application is 32 by default, and can be increased by requesting a limit increase. If application load is reduced, the service can reduce the CurrentParallelism value down to the Parallelism setting.

nested_items.name: ParallelismPerKPU
nested_items.description: Describes the number of parallel tasks that a Managed Service for Apache Flink application can perform per Kinesis Processing Unit (KPU) used by the application.

nested_items.name: CurrentParallelism
nested_items.description: Describes the current number of parallel tasks that a Managed Service for Apache Flink application can perform. If AutoScalingEnabled is set to True, Managed Service for Apache Flink can increase this value in response to application load. The service can increase this value up to the maximum parallelism, which is ParalellismPerKPU times the maximum KPUs for the application. The maximum KPUs for an application is 32 by default, and can be increased by requesting a limit increase. If application load is reduced, the service can reduce the CurrentParallelism value down to the Parallelism setting.

nested_items.name: AutoScalingEnabled
nested_items.description: Describes whether the Managed Service for Apache Flink service can increase the parallelism of the application in response to increased throughput.

nested_items.name: JobPlanDescription
nested_items.description: The job plan for an application. For more information about the job plan, see Jobs and Scheduling in the Apache Flink Documentation. To retrieve the job plan for the application, use the  DescribeApplicationRequest$IncludeAdditionalDetails parameter of the  DescribeApplication operation.

nested_items.name: EnvironmentPropertyDescriptions
nested_items.description: Describes execution properties for a Managed Service for Apache Flink application.

nested_items.name: PropertyGroupDescriptions
nested_items.description: Describes the execution property groups.

nested_items.name: PropertyGroupId
nested_items.description: Describes the key of an application execution property key-value pair.

nested_items.name: PropertyMap
nested_items.description: Describes the value of an application execution property key-value pair.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ApplicationSnapshotConfigurationDescription
nested_items.description: Describes whether snapshots are enabled for a Managed Service for Apache Flink application.

nested_items.name: SnapshotsEnabled
nested_items.description: Describes whether snapshots are enabled for a Managed Service for Apache Flink application.

nested_items.name: ApplicationSystemRollbackConfigurationDescription
nested_items.description: Describes whether system rollbacks are enabled for a Managed Service for Apache Flink application.

nested_items.name: VpcConfigurationDescriptions
nested_items.description: The array of descriptions of VPC configurations available to the application.

nested_items.name: VpcConfigurationId
nested_items.description: The ID of the VPC configuration.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The ID of the associated VPC.

nested_items.name: SubnetIds
nested_items.description: The array of Subnet IDs used by the VPC configuration.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The array of SecurityGroup IDs used by the VPC configuration.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ZeppelinApplicationConfigurationDescription
nested_items.description: The configuration parameters for a Managed Service for Apache Flink Studio notebook.

nested_items.name: MonitoringConfigurationDescription
nested_items.description: The monitoring configuration of a Managed Service for Apache Flink Studio notebook.

nested_items.name: LogLevel
nested_items.description: Describes the verbosity of the CloudWatch Logs for an application.

nested_items.name: CatalogConfigurationDescription
nested_items.description: The Amazon Glue Data Catalog that is associated with the Managed Service for Apache Flink Studio notebook.

nested_items.name: GlueDataCatalogConfigurationDescription
nested_items.description: The configuration parameters for the default Amazon Glue database. You use this database for SQL queries that you write in a Managed Service for Apache Flink Studio notebook.

nested_items.name: DatabaseARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the database.

nested_items.name: DeployAsApplicationConfigurationDescription
nested_items.description: The parameters required to deploy a Managed Service for Apache Flink Studio notebook as an application with durable state.

nested_items.name: S3ContentLocationDescription
nested_items.description: The location that holds the data required to specify an Amazon Data Analytics application.

nested_items.name: BucketARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: BasePath
nested_items.description: The base path for the S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: CustomArtifactsConfigurationDescription
nested_items.description: Custom artifacts are dependency JARs and user-defined functions (UDF).

nested_items.name: ArtifactType
nested_items.description: UDF stands for user-defined functions. This type of artifact must be in an S3 bucket. A DEPENDENCY_JAR can be in either Maven or an S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: S3ContentLocationDescription
nested_items.description: For a Managed Service for Apache Flink application provides a description of an Amazon S3 object, including the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the S3 bucket, the name of the Amazon S3 object that contains the data, and the version number of the Amazon S3 object that contains the data.

nested_items.name: BucketARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the S3 bucket containing the application code.

nested_items.name: FileKey
nested_items.description: The file key for the object containing the application code.

nested_items.name: ObjectVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the object containing the application code.

nested_items.name: MavenReferenceDescription
nested_items.description: The parameters that are required to specify a Maven dependency.

nested_items.name: GroupId
nested_items.description: The group ID of the Maven reference.

nested_items.name: ArtifactId
nested_items.description: The artifact ID of the Maven reference.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The version of the Maven reference.

nested_items.name: CloudWatchLoggingOptionDescriptions
nested_items.description: Describes the application Amazon CloudWatch logging options.

nested_items.name: CloudWatchLoggingOptionId
nested_items.description: The ID of the CloudWatch logging option description.

nested_items.name: LogStreamARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CloudWatch log to receive application messages.

nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: The IAM ARN of the role to use to send application messages.

nested_items.name: ApplicationMaintenanceConfigurationDescription
nested_items.description: The details of the maintenance configuration for the application.

nested_items.name: ApplicationMaintenanceWindowStartTime
nested_items.description: The start time for the maintenance window.

nested_items.name: ApplicationMaintenanceWindowEndTime
nested_items.description: The end time for the maintenance window.

nested_items.name: ApplicationVersionUpdatedFrom
nested_items.description: The previous application version before the latest application update.  RollbackApplication reverts the application to this version.

nested_items.name: ApplicationVersionRolledBackFrom
nested_items.description: If you reverted the application using  RollbackApplication, the application version when RollbackApplication was called.

nested_items.name: ConditionalToken
nested_items.description: A value you use to implement strong concurrency for application updates.

nested_items.name: ApplicationVersionRolledBackTo
nested_items.description: The version to which you want to roll back the application.

nested_items.name: ApplicationMode
nested_items.description: To create a Managed Service for Apache Flink Studio notebook, you must set the mode to INTERACTIVE. However, for a Managed Service for Apache Flink application, the mode is optional.
